item.title: Maria add a quote by Douglas Adams
Maria add a quote by Kate Chopin
item.description: "The bird that would soar above the level plain of tradition and prejudice must have strong wings. It is a sad spectacle to see the weaklings bruised, exhausted, fluttering back to earth." -- Kate Chopin

item.title: Maria add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. Only I will remain." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Maria add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "When I was a child, adults would tell me not to make things up, warning me of what would happen if I did. As far as I can tell so far, it seems to involve lots of foreign travel and not having to get up too early in the morning." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Maria add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Maria add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Maria add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: Maria add a quote by Howard Zinn
item.description: "There is no flag large enough to cover the shame of killing innocent people." -- Howard Zinn

item.title: Maria add a quote by Arthur William Edgar O'Shaughnessy
item.description: "We are the music makers, and we are the dreamers of dreams." -- Arthur William Edgar O'Shaughnessy

item.title: Maria add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "At eighteen our convictions are hills from which we look; at forty-five they are caves in which we hide." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Maria add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Alice wonders if other women in the middle of the night have begun to resent their Formica." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Maria add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway
